headline.seo: Denver Pedestrians Promote Walking’s Urban Potential
headline.print_headline: Denver Is Urged to Hit the Sidewalks
headline.main: Denver Is Urged to Hit the Sidewalks

docs.abstract: Walk Denver, a non-profit group that promotes walking for its health and social benefits, offers several programs, including a monthly stroll with physicians, to encourage residents to walk around the city more.
docs.lead_paragraph: In a state known for its fitness, advocates are promoting walking as a means of urban transportation.
docs.snippet: In a state known for its fitness, advocates are promoting walking as a means of urban transportation.

headline.main: 18 And Under: A Discussion on Screening Children for Cholesterol

docs.abstract: Panel convened by the National Heart, Lung and Blood institute publishes report in journal Pediatrics issuing guidelines concerning the cardiovascular health of children; panel's recommendation that pediatricians perform cholesterol-screening blood tests on all 9- to 11-year-olds has provoked considerable controversy, including two commentaries in prominent journals. Drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: It doesn't have a particularly snappy title, but the Summary Report of the Expert Panel on Integrated Guidelines for Cardiovascular Health and Risk Reduction in Children and Adolescents makes for surprisingly accessible and interesting reading. For one thing, it's well written, especially for a scientific report and a set of clinical guidelines. For another, the report, published in late 2011 in the journal Pediatrics, takes on a question at once basic and profound: What do we know about how the hearts of children become the hearts of adults?
docs.snippet: It doesn't have a particularly snappy title, but the Summary Report of the Expert Panel on Integrated Guidelines for Cardiovascular Health and Risk Reduction in Children and Adolescents makes for surprisingly accessible and interesting reading.    ...

headline.main: Let's Move, She Said — and We Have

docs.abstract: In just two years, Michelle Obama’s campaign against childhood obesity has prompted legislation and begun to change how food companies do business.
docs.snippet: In just two years, Michelle Obama’s campaign against childhood obesity has prompted legislation and begun to change how food companies do business.

headline.print_headline: How About a Nice Fresh Orange to Go With Your Cheetos?
headline.main: How About a Nice Fresh Orange to Go With Your Cheetos?

headline.print_headline: Two Classes Divided by a Kitchen Door
headline.main: Two Classes Divided by a Kitchen Door

docs.lead_paragraph: In America today, restaurants are some of the last places where the educated elite mingle with the working class.

headline.seo: Austin and Rio Grande Valley Both Want Texas’ Next Four-Year Medical School

docs.lead_paragraph: A focus on health-care education in Texas may result in a new four-year medical school, but both sophisticated Austin and the poverty-stricken Rio Grande Valley want it.
docs.snippet: A focus on health-care education in Texas may result in a new four-year medical school, but both sophisticated Austin and the poverty-stricken Rio Grande Valley want it.

headline.main: Blood Levels of Trans Fats Are Declining in Americans

docs.abstract: A new report shows that since 2000, levels of trans fats in Americans' bloodstreams have plummeted nearly 60 percent.
docs.snippet: A new report shows that since 2000, levels of trans fats in Americans' bloodstreams have plummeted nearly 60 percent.

headline.main: Blood Levels of Trans Fats Are Declining in Americans

docs.abstract: A new report shows that since 2000, levels of trans fats in Americans' bloodstreams have plummeted nearly 60 percent.
docs.lead_paragraph: The intense battle that public health advocates have waged against trans fats appears to be working: A new report shows that since 2000, levels of trans fats in Americans' bloodstreams have plummeted nearly 60 percent.
docs.snippet: A new report shows that since 2000, levels of trans fats in Americans' bloodstreams have plummeted nearly 60 percent.
